snippet: Through a lawyer, the family of the man killed by Boston police said they knew nothing of his alleged affinity for Islamic extremists or the reports that he threatened to behead police officers.
abstract: Family of Usaamah Rahim, Boston man who was shot after FBI agent and police officer say he threatened them with knife, dispute image painted of him by law enforcement; say they knew nothing of his alleged affinity for Islamic extremists nor his reported threat to behead police officers; middle class family seems shaken and shocked in first appearance since death.

byline.original: By JESS BIDGOOD and DAVE PHILIPPS
byline.contributor: Jess Bidgood reported from Boston, and Dave Philipps from New York. Alain Delaquérière contributed research.

lead_paragraph: Through a lawyer, the family of the man killed by Boston police said they knew nothing of his alleged affinity for Islamic extremists or the reports that he threatened to behead police officers.

headline.main: Portrait of Suspect in Boston Is Disputed
headline.print_headline: Portrait of Suspect in Boston Is Disputed

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
